intro: Mitella oppositifolia, commonly known as the opposite-leaved mitella, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of North America. It is a member of the Saxifragaceae family and is characterized by its opposite leaf arrangement and delicate, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. Its foliage consists of oval-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Mitella oppositifolia is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to thrive in cooler climates.
